message_1: A sample of radioactive material has a half-life of 10 days. If the initial activity of the sample was 1000 Bq, determine its activity after 30 days.
message_2:
To determine the activity of the radioactive material after 30 days, we can use the formula for radioactive decay:

Activity_final = Activity_initial * (1/2)^(time_elapsed / half_life)

where Activity_final is the activity after 30 days, Activity_initial is the initial activity (1000 Bq), time_elapsed is the time that has passed (30 days), and half_life is the half-life of the material (10 days).

Activity_final = 1000 Bq * (1/2)^(30 days / 10 days)

Activity_final = 1000 Bq * (1/2)^3

Activity_final = 1000 Bq * (1/8)

Activity_final = 125 Bq

So, the activity of the radioactive material after 30 days is 125 Bq.
